childMarkdownRemark.html:
Now, this is a story all about how, my life got flipped-turned upside down, and I'd like to take a minute, just sit right there, I'll tell you how I became the prince of a town called KL

In Scunthorpe, UK, born and raised, on the playground was where I spent most of my days, chillin' out maxin' relaxin' all cool, and all shootin some b-ball outside of the school, when a couple of guys who were up to no good, started making trouble in my neighborhood, I got in one little fight and my mom got scared, she said 'You're movin' with your father in Kuala Lumpur'

Born in Scunthorpe, United Kingdom, I spent the first 15 years of my life growing up there, I was given an opportunity to move to Kuala Lumpur since my dad was working here and I have been living here ever since.

Coming on to 14 years living here (at the time of writing), I went through my high school years, GCSE and A-Levels at Alice Smith School in Kuala Lumpur.

I moved back to the UK for a period of 2 years to attend Sheffield Hallam University and study Automotive Design Technology. After completing 2 years, I decided to drop out for a couple of reasons. One being that there were some issues with my course (won't go into details on that but it was very demotivating), secondly, I had a chance to work here in an automotive performance workshop doing what I had dreamed of doing my whole life.

After spending 4 going on 5 years working in that industry, I realised while my passion lied with fast cars, it wasn't a career I wanted to continue pursuing as the aspect of work and hobby were starting to lose touch.

I decided to make a leap of faith and pursue a new career as a Software Developer. Growing up I had always been the sort of person that enjoys building things with my own two hands and mind. It was a no brainer given that I also enjoy technology, design and engineering things. I attended a bootcamp at NEXT Academy to pursue my career in tech. Having graduated, I immediately took a job as a mentor at NEXT Academy, teaching the next wave of students coming through the ranks.

Ever since then, I have fallen in love with Web Development, Software Development and any other names it may go by, there is a real sense of achievement seeing the things created with your fingertips and mind, come to fruition.

The hunger for knowledge will never stop with software, nor will the evolution of technology and need for it in all aspects of life. So, here's to a long future in the software development world and driving the next generation of website, applications and software.

Here are the current technology stacks I am working with or I am familiar with. Since the evolution of technology is ever changing in the software world, this list will more than likely change from time to time as the stacks I work with and the technology I know grows.
